article: In 1957, an Irish family moved into the house next to ours, and the son John was in my class at school. And he  _  became well-known to the young and the old. Although many of the adults in the neighborhood regarded John as "a bit of a rogue", he was still  _  with all the kids, because in many ways he was like a leader, and that made  _  one of us. His cheeks were always red and if he asked you to take part in some  _  , whether it was picking mushrooms, checking rabbit traps or just going to the shops, you would feel  _  or at least pleased to be included. But this some-times came at a cost . I can  _  feeling quite uncomfortable when, for example, he  _  a shop assistant for the items on high shelves. He would put some goods into our pockets, while he  _  his conversation with the assistant who turned her back towards us. I worried that my parents would be angry if I told them  _  we had done. He always said, "The police won't take us alive." But I still  _  to stay far away from him in the end. Now I'm glad to make the right decision at that time.
